basic.description: An introductory course on the use of computers in science. Topics include: solving linear and nonlinear equations, interpolation, integration, and numerical solutions of ordinary differential equations. Extensive use is made of MATLAB, a high level interactive numerical package.
basic.subject: MATH
basic.title: Applications of Numerical Methods

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite of MATH110 or MATH111 and  CISC101 or CISC121 and a corequisite of MATH232.
Exclusion    No more than 3.0 units from CISC271; MATH272; PHYS313.
